001package imagingbook.lib.filter;
002
003import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack;
004
005/**
006 * This (abstract) class represents a generic vector filter whose pixel-operation
007 * is x/y-separable.
008 * It is similar to {@link GenericFilterVector} but requires two methods to
009 * be implemented by concrete sub-classes: 
010 * {@link #doPixelX(PixelPack, int, int)} and {@link #doPixelY(PixelPack, int, int)}
011 * for the x- and y-pass, respectively,
012 * which are invoked in exactly this order.
013 * The remaining filter mechanics
014 * including out-of-bounds coordinate handling,
015 * multiple passes and data copying are handled by this class and its super-class
016 * (see {@link GenericFilter}). 
017 */
018public abstract class GenericFilterVectorSeparable extends GenericFilter { // GenericFilterVector
019        
020        private int iter = 0;
021        private int iterMax = 1;        // for progress reporting only
022        
023        @Override 
024        protected void runPass(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) {
025                final int width = source.getWidth();
026                final int height = source.getHeight();
027                iterMax = width * height * 2;
028                iter = 0;
029                
030                // X-part
031                //IJ.log("X-part +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++");
032                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
033                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
034                                target.setVec(u, v, doPixelX(source, u, v)); // single pixel operation
035                                iter++;
036                        }
037                }
038                
039                target.copyTo(source);
040                
041                // Y-part
042                //IJ.log("Y-part +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++");
043                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
044                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
045                                target.setVec(u, v, doPixelY(source, u, v)); // single pixel operation
046                                iter++;
047                        }
048                }
049                iter = 0;
050        }
051        
052        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
053
054        /**
055         * Applies a 1D filter operation in x-direction.
056         * This method must be implemented by concrete sub-classes.
057         * This method is invoked before {@link #doPixelY(PixelPack, int, int)}.
058         * The source data are passed as a {@link PixelPack} container, which
059         * holds the vector values of all image components.
060         * The method {@link PixelPack#getVec(int, int)} should be used to read
061         * individual pixel vectors. These data should not be modified but
062         * the (float[]) result of the single-pixel calculation must be returned.
063         * Implementations are free to return the same float-array at each invocation,
064         * i.e., there is no need to allocate a new array every time.
065         * 
066         * @param source the scalar-valued data for a single image component
067         * @param u the current x-position
068         * @param v the current y-position
069         * @return the result of the filter calculation for this pixel
070         */
071        protected abstract float[] doPixelX(PixelPack source, int u, int v);
072
073        /**
074         * Applies a 1D filter operation in y-direction.
075         * This method must be implemented by concrete sub-classes.
076         * This method is invoked after {@link #doPixelX(PixelPack, int, int)}.
077         * The source data are passed as a {@link PixelPack} container, which
078         * holds the vector values of all image components.
079         * The method {@link PixelPack#getVec(int, int)} should be used to read
080         * individual pixel vectors. These data should not be modified but
081         * the (float[]) result of the single-pixel calculation must be returned.
082         * Implementations are free to return the same float-array at each invocation,
083         * i.e., there is no need to allocate a new array every time.
084         * 
085         * @param source the scalar-valued data for a single image component
086         * @param u the current x-position
087         * @param v the current y-position
088         * @return the result of the filter calculation for this pixel
089         */
090        protected abstract float[] doPixelY(PixelPack source, int u, int v);
091        
092        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
093
094        @Override
095        protected final double reportProgress(double subProgress) {
096                double localProgress = (double) iter /iterMax;
097                //System.out.println("GenericFilterVector: reportProgress() - returning " + localProgress);
098                return super.reportProgress(localProgress);
099        }
100        
101}
